content: How can I help you today?

I've been having a hard time sleeping lately. I feel overwhelmed by work and worried about potentially losing my job, which has been making it hard to turn my brain off at night. I just keep replaying scenarios in my mind, and then I end up on my phone, which I know makes things worse. My partner suggested I talk to someone, but honestly, I’m not sure how this will help.

Thank you for sharing that. It sounds like work stress and worry about your job have been weighing heavily on your mind, and it's affecting your sleep as well. Replaying scenarios and turning to your phone might feel like a way to cope in the moment, even though you recognize it may not help. It’s understandable to be unsure about how talking might help, especially when everything feels overwhelming. What do you think might make a difference for you right now?

I'm not really sure what would help, to be honest. I mean, I'd like to stop stressing so much at night so I can actually sleep, but the work stuff is just always there in the back of my mind. It's not like I can just stop worrying about losing my job or providing for my family, you know? If I could turn those thoughts off, I would.

It sounds like you’re feeling stuck because the thoughts about work and providing for your family are deeply tied to what really matters to you—your responsibilities and your loved ones. Those worries make it hard to relax, even though you’d like to. You’re carrying a lot on your shoulders, and that’s not easy. When you think about getting to a place where you can sleep better and stress less, what do you imagine that might look like?

I guess if I could just go to bed and fall asleep without my mind racing, that would make everything feel so much better. I’d love to wake up feeling rested instead of dragging myself through the day. But honestly, I can’t even picture that right now with how everything’s been.

It makes sense that it’s hard to picture feeling rested right now, given how much stress you’re carrying. Falling asleep peacefully and waking up with energy sounds like something you’d really value, though, and it speaks to how much you want to take care of yourself and face your days more refreshed. Even if things feel heavy right now, it sounds like the idea of change might be important to you. What do you think could help move you even a little closer to that?

I’m really not sure what could help. I want to feel better, but it feels like I’ve tried everything—distracting myself, staying up late to work, even just ignoring it—but nothing’s really worked. Part of me feels like maybe I just have to deal with it, but another part of me wants to believe there’s something else I can do to sleep better and feel less overwhelmed.

It sounds like you’ve been doing your best to manage these feelings in the ways you know how, but it hasn’t brought the relief you’re hoping for. You seem to be caught between accepting this as your reality and holding onto hope that something can change. That tension is totally understandable, and it shows how much you want things to be different. It might not feel clear now, but what helps you think that change could still be possible?

I'm not totally sure, honestly. I guess it's the fact that I don't want to keep feeling like this—I want to be better for my partner, my kids, and myself. And maybe part of me still hopes that there's a way, even if I don’t know what it is right now.

It sounds like the reason you keep hoping is because of how much you care—not just about yourself, but about being present and better for your family. That hope shows a lot of strength and desire for change, even in the middle of feeling stuck. It’s clear that they mean a lot to you, and you’re not giving up on finding some relief. What do you think is one small thing that might help you take even a first step toward feeling better?

I’m not totally sure what that first step would be. Turning off my phone at night might help, but even the thought of that feels hard because it’s what I turn to when my thoughts won’t stop. Maybe I need to just focus on managing my stress at work somehow, but I wouldn’t even know where to start with that either.

It sounds like you’re considering a couple of different possibilities—whether it’s changing how you handle your evenings or finding ways to manage stress during the workday. Both of those ideas seem connected to your goal of sleeping better and feeling less overwhelmed. Even though turning off your phone feels tough right now, it sounds like you’re open to exploring ways to create more ease in your life. What are your thoughts on taking small steps toward either of these ideas?

I think small steps might be the only way to go right now. Maybe I could try setting a limit on my phone use at night—like putting it down 10 or 15 minutes earlier and seeing how that goes. As for work, I have no idea where to even begin, but I guess I could start by figuring out what’s actually causing me the most stress there.

That sounds like a thoughtful way to start—setting a small limit on phone use in the evenings and exploring the root of your work stress both seem manageable and realistic. By breaking things down into smaller steps, you're giving yourself more room to try something new without overwhelming yourself further. It takes courage to make even small changes when things feel tough, and you're showing that courage here. Is there anything else you’d like to talk about before planning next steps?
I think I am okay to end the conversation. Thank you for speaking about this with me.
